label: 国司
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: the provincial governing team that comprised a group of up to 7 administrators sent out from the capital to govern each province, as mandated by the ritsuryô Law on Personnel (Shikiinryô 職員令). But the term is also used to denote only the head of the team, its director (kami 守), who in the ninth century came to be called the “custodial governor” (zuryô 受領) because of his fiscal accountability to the court. [律令]
